name: NSMenuDelegate
desc: The optional methods implemented by delegates of NSMenu objects to manage menu display and handle some events.

items.name: func menuHasKeyEquivalent(NSMenu, for: NSEvent, target: AutoreleasingUnsafeMutablePointer<AnyObject?>, action: UnsafeMutablePointer<Selector?>) -> Bool
items.desc: Invoked to allow the delegate to return the target and action for a key-down event.

items.name: func menu(NSMenu, update: NSMenuItem, at: Int, shouldCancel: Bool) -> Bool
items.desc: Invoked to let the delegate update a menu item before it is displayed.

items.name: func confinementRect(for: NSMenu, on: NSScreen?) -> NSRect
items.desc: Invoked to allow the delegate to specify a display location for the menu.

items.name: func menu(NSMenu, willHighlight: NSMenuItem?)
items.desc: Invoked to indicate that a menu is about to highlight a given item.

items.name: func menuWillOpen(NSMenu)
items.desc: Invoked when a menu is about to open.

items.name: func numberOfItems(in: NSMenu) -> Int
items.desc: Invoked when a menu is about to be displayed at the start of a tracking session so the delegate can specify the number of items in the menu.

items.name: func menuNeedsUpdate(NSMenu)
items.desc: Invoked when a menu is about to be displayed at the start of a tracking session.
